reviews.review_msg: Often disorganized/late for class, shut people down which was awkward and stifled dialogue. Was not clear with expectations for assignments. Too many films assigned with very little time to discuss them, and no opportunity to engage with theories from the weekly readings. The films and readings were good.

So disorganized! Our class was on women, poverty and the media, but it ended up being a class on the Downtown Eastside, as viewed by the National Film Board. Even tho it was a media course, she couldn't even use the computer. Horrible classroom, patronizing teacher, vague requirements for assignments and grades given back sporadically. Hated this!
I enjoyed attending her classes. Her lectures and readings were challenging and engaging.

Interesting course, good material.. she rambles a lot though and doesn't make good use of the time she has.. (tends to lose track of time) and therefore doesnt leave enough time for discussion/questions.. not too bad but a little dry.
